Reviews.Content: we were visiting the wine country for my husbands birthday and wanted to take a day to ourselves and relax and recharge our internal batteries - The Roman Spa Hot Springs was our answer - i found it through Trip Advisor and we used the "special" that was offered - room, spa services, dinner and breakfast (wine tasting coupons too) - it was fabulous - nothing to worry about but tips for spa and meals...room was comfortable, close to spa facility, pools nice and warm, dinner at Brannans GREAT as usual (walk one block to main street) , breakfast at Cafe Sarafornia AWESOME - SPA SERVICES TERRIFIC - MIKE AND GINA were fantastic...we will definately come back and include another day of relaxation and spa activity....till next time

Reviews.Title: “A spa for all seasons......hold the attitude!”
Reviews.Author: etsudo
Reviews.Content: In winter, the steam rises over the outdoor heated mineral pool and the jacuzzi feels sooooo good; spring the pots are filled with tulips and daffodils and the sun warms your bones; summer you sip wine under an umbrella beneath the wisteria covered arbor and listen to the cooling sounds of the fountain; fall brings the smell of grape crush and the cool mornings chase you into the heated indoor mineral pool. We've enjoyed the Roman Spa in every season and are always grateful for the spotlessly clean rooms, the well-kept mineral pools, the beautifully planted grounds, and the well-maintained bar-b-que areas.......without the 'attitude' of your typical wine country spa. You can walk one block to town for an evening ice cream or a great meal.....leaving the car behind. It's quiet, easy going, and pet-free. With kitchens available to us, it's a no brainer for a reasonably priced stay in the wine country. We'll be back, as always.

Reviews.Title: “Not pretentious and quaint”
Reviews.Author: DRAnalytics
Reviews.Content: My friend came to visit from the midwest and we needed to just go take a break together and relax- the Roman Spa was the perfect spot. The pool is relaxing (102 degrees) and curved so has a nice feeling and not just a square box. It has the jacuzzi right there as well so easy to jump form one to the other. All of the outdoor area, pool, hotel rooms, grounds..., is lined with chairs and plants and so many flowers. Inside, they have a more private pool with also a steam room. The rooms are comfortable- actually quite big. Not a spa type of room but more like comfortable and affordable. They have spa treatment on site also but my massage was not my favorite. The mud bath and soak in soap water was really great, though.

Reviews.Title: “Beds suck”
Reviews.Author: memily9
Reviews.Content: The beds are horrible uncomfortable, you would think for $200 a night they could afford mattresses from the 21st century. Not to mention there was a cockroach in our bathroom. The setting is beautiful, the pools are amazing. The rooms are outdated, ugly and uncomfortable. For the price there are way nicer rooms at other hotels down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous!!”
Reviews.Author: OZSacramento
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort for my 50th b-day. It was the best excellent accommodation, clean and it's accessible to many restaurant and other entertainment functions.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Mud Baths and Relaxing Geothermal Pools at Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: rebecca3rebecca
Reviews.Content: Visited the Roman Spa and although I would recommend booking ahead we were able to walk in and book for the same afternoon. Easy to find and free parking on site just off the main Calistoga drag, off Washington. What fun my Dad and I had - first time in a mud bath and although the first sensation was, very odd ! we soon slipped into the relaxing mud bath where all tension, aches and pains, melted away. Betty on reception was professional and welcoming and Eric talked us through the whole treatment clearly and calmly with a constant supply of cooling head towels and refreshing water as we melted into a dream like relaxed stupor moving from the individual mud bath to a glorious individual mineral spa bath . We had a private room and in no way felt any rush to finish the treatments but weren't left to melt, with Eric constantly checking to see we were ok. The spa is down to earth and friendly with no overly done Zen like preciousness and, as day visitors, we were made to feel as welcome as if we were hotel residents, which I will definiteley consider for my next visit. This is an all round attraction and a great balance to days of wine tasting, particularly if, like us, you happen to hit Napa on a rainy day - once you're in the indoor and outdoor pools, spas, sauna or just enjoying a quiet snooze it is simply heaven on earth. I look forward to returning soon and with Calistoga having so much to offer, wine, food, museums, a geyser, petrified forests.... and lake Tahoe skiing a couple of hours away don't miss it !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay for Ladies Two Night Getaway”
Reviews.Author: brightasday
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed at the Roman Spa many times over the past 22 years that we have been going to Calistoga. The rooms are very comfortable and they have upgraded them with new white comforters and new ruffle dusters. The bathrooms have been upgraded with new tub/shower stalls and very fluffy soft towels. The room we stay in has a kitchenette with all new utensils, pots/pans, toaster, etc. The grounds are full of different flowers and greenery and kept up nicely. They also have a really nice outdoor swimming pool and indoor sauna. You don't have to go far for a massage as it is all connected to the Spa. It's also really great that they are so close to the main street and we only have to walk about one block to the main street where you can shop or go to all of the different restaurants that Calistoga has to offer. We have always enjoyed our stay here and plan to go back in November.

Reviews.Title: “It's the greatest place to relax, unwind and be pampered.”
Reviews.Author: Germanytrip-Fan
Reviews.Content: This resort is the greatest get-away in the Napa Valley Wine Country. The atmosphere is very European and the landscape with all the flowers and tropical plants are just beautiful. The 3 Mineral pools let you spend hours in the water to give your whole well-being a great lift. The employees are very friendly and everybody is trying to spoil you wherever they can. Can't wait to go back to this beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabuloso!”
Reviews.Author: MillicentMayfair
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Roman Spa for many years. Everything has been upgraded - from the huge showerheads, the shampoos and conditioners and lotions, the kitchen utensils not to forget the fresh bed linens and bed covers. Our room was spotless. The pool the gardens and the pathways were abundant with flowers in bloom .... especially the gorgeous tulips - everywhere. It was so enjoyable to sit outside with a glass wine. It was a true retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: davensheri
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a family suite for five with a kitchen it had everything we needed to cook nice meals along with a wonderful bbq area picnic tables surrounded by a lovely landscape of flowers the room was very clean staff friendly,and the water wonderful i will go back to Roman Spa!

Reviews.Title: “A HEALING ADVENTURE”
Reviews.Author: heartspeak106
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and really enjoyed the facilities. Hot tubs and pool were a main attraction, as I was recovering from knee replacement surgery six weeks earlier. We go to this Spa about once each year, and have for many years. It is quiet and has excellent service. I would highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys or needs a relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: Halcyon37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night during our trip to Napa for wine tastings. Be sure to check the hotel website for specials. We got the manager's special which included a one night stay and a massage for both of us. Our massage therapists were great (Matt and Khalid)! I don't think either of us has ever been so relaxed! The hotel has a great location, just near the main drag with all the restaurants, but still far enough away that you don't hear any noise during the night. It's a bit of an older place, but everything is clean and well-maintained. Their gardens are lovely. And the service was excellent all around, everyone was so welcoming and friendly. I would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to end a weekend of winery hopping”
Reviews.Author: Imissthesun
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about the resort. My only regret is that we could not spend more time there. The hot springs pools are incredable - we did the mud bath and a massage and as my husband said it would be impossible to be more relaxed. Get there early enjoy the pools - the town of Calistoga was a great place to walk around. Loved it!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: maatgrch
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa is everything you are looking for in a spa. The rooms are spotless and the beds are luxurious! Our room had a fully equipped kitchen allowing us to have our meals in if we preferred. The three pools are fabulous beyond words and steps from our room. All we really needed to bring was our bathing suits and a robe! The main street through the charming town of Calistoga is walking distance from the spa with unique shops and quality restaurants right there. Once you park your car, there is no need to move it until its time to go home! The grounds are lovingly maintained and the gardens are beautiful with the daffodils in full bloom and hummingbird feeders everywhere! My traveling companion is handicapped and the staff accomodated our request for a ground floor room near the pools. Our visit was superb!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional holiday getaway”
Reviews.Author: violetJoy
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa provides a pleasant atmosphere for total relaxation. The rooms are clean and attractive with comfortable beds. Management and staff are friendly and efficient. Calistoga is an interesting historic setting in the beautiful Napa Valley with fine restaurants and interesting shops. We experienced an exceptional brief holiday getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Complete relaxation in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: mcmickeyd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed for one night at the Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort because we have family in Calistoga. We wanted to enjoy the spa experience and were not disappointed. We had a lovely, very comfortable room with a spa tub. It was very relaxing and we also used the three hot springs pools in the beautiful courtyard. The resort is within walking distance of the market and many wonderful restaurants. It was so romantic and relaxing to have a delicious dinner then a refreshing short walk back to our room where the spa was waiting. We picked up dessert at the market and were able to enjoy it in our room later with a bottle of wine as there was a refrigerator in the room. They also have complimentary gourmet coffee. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Soak Up a Great Wine Country Value”
Reviews.Author: StillMarried
Reviews.Content: We've been spending our Grown-Ups Only vacations at The Roman Spa in Calistoga for fifteen years. Every time we are there, we meet other couples who are proud to claim: "We've been coming here for 20 years!" "Love this place, we're here every year." The hotel seem to inspire a kind of loyalty that is rare these days. The grounds are lovely and very well-maintained. You can spend the day going from mineral pool to mineral pool (there are three) and soak up the healing waters and when you've soaked enough, lounge in the dry sauna. The hotel is a short block from the Lincoln Ave -- Calistoga's main street -- where you can enjoy a huge array of restaurants, boutique shopping and outstanding people-watching. The rooms at the Roman Spa are comfortable, clean and well-appointed. The maid staff works very hard to keep the whole place immaculately clean. First-rate spa services are just across the parking lot at The Baths. I've stayed other places in Napa Valley, but this hotel offers the very best facilities for the price and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pools great, massage NOT”
Reviews.Author: jojoagogo
Reviews.Content: It was a Friday and we had the place to ourselves. There are 2 pools and a Jacuzzi. The outdoor pool was 99 and the indoor jet pool was 102. Perfectly relaxing. The surroundings are just ok; clean enough, but not that attractive. It was a rainy day about 45 degrees but we were fine in the pool outdoors. The massage, by K____, was not good. I told him it was too hard for me and he eased off but then right back to way too much pressure. I mentioned again that it was uncomfortable. At the end when I told him I had to literally "tolerate" the pain, he asked me how long it had been since my last massage (how is that important) and told me I had years of tension built up. Uh! Whatever. I should not have to PAY for a pain inducing treatment. I am in pain today like I have been bruised and beaten. Not my idea of being pampered. Can't comment on the hotel but I peaked into the rooms and they looked very average and a bit outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing.. !"”
Reviews.Author: 1977cloud
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night. Very nice garden setting. The three pools were each a different temperature which was nice. A little heavy on the chlorine on the inside pool, and I'm not crazy about plastic plants and flowers! Also, for the price, I was hoping for a coffee maker in the room. Overall it was a lovely experience though....

Reviews.Title: “Cute, affordable motel.”
Reviews.Author: Dianica
Reviews.Content: Cute, affordable motel. Chose this room because it had a full kitchen. Room was good size though pretty outdated. It's a comfortable place to stay in Calistoga, walking distance to everything. What I liked about it was the proximity to everything, the spas and pools accessible to hotel guests (which was nice to come home to after long day of wine tasting and other spas), and the kitchen. There are nicer places to stay, but the price and amenities make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “The best birthday present”
Reviews.Author: caravanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband takes me to Roman Spa in November for my birthday. It is sooooo relaxing and we love the little town. Staff at Roman Spa are always very pleasant and the rooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A very quiet, calming and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: warriormaid
Reviews.Content: The pools are wonderful - very nice sized and different temperatures of water. It was a holiday week-end and the facility was very quiet. It is walking distance to downtown Calistoga. The room was clean and well attended. I wish I was still there.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss in the Waters!!”
Reviews.Author: Gus90
Reviews.Content: If you want to go soak in the mineral baths in a surrounding of charming and luscious gardens and fountains, Roman Spa is the perfect spot! And you won't be disappointed with the comfortable beds, spacious rooms, spa services available, and the TLC provided by the friendly staff. Roman Spa is a real find whether you just want to relax and soak in the pools (yes, there is more than one) or tour the wineries, or both!

Reviews.Title: “Aaaahhhhhh, this is the life.”
Reviews.Author: happynapan
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa in Calistoga is a wonderful place to go for pure relaxation. The grounds are lovely with seasonal flowers and decorations to celebrate the particular time of year. We just returned from an October weekend and enjoyed the beautiful fall colors in the flowers and the pumpkins and squash clustered around the flower beds. The rooms are attractive - very clean and well equipped. There are three mineral baths, a large outdoor pool, a smaller indoor pool and a very warm jacuzzi. You can float around for hours and feel absolutely weightless and wonderful. There are many chaise lounge chairs around the pool and picnic tables with bar-b-qs in different areas outside the rooms. Our favorite part of the stay is enjoying the massage and spa treatments at the Baths which are located across the parking lot from the hotel. The service is excellent and you can be completely pampered. We have been going to the Roman Spa for 10 years, in every season and in every kind of weather and have always enjoyed the most relaxing and stressfree times.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Dakotaken
Reviews.Content: Nice room...we had the 2 BR with kitchenette. Very cleanand comfortable. Just a short walk (one block) to Lincoln Ave, the main street of Calistoga with many good places to eat, but also a very quiet area. Outstanding mineral pools and grounds! Very enjoyable! I would highly recommend & return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever to spend a "major" birthday!”
Reviews.Author: RVIA
Reviews.Content: I suggest everyone who turns a decade should spend a week at the Roman Spa. I did, and cajoled friends and family to rent rooms as well. The front desk is wonderful (as compared to five plus years ago...night and day); the facilities remain in good shape and continue to look fresh, and the pools are still the most fun ever. I have stayed there at least fifteen times (almost my only choice in Calistoga now that Nance's burned) and it keeps getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Comfy Sofa”
Reviews.Author: SLOBetty
Reviews.Content: Notice how many reviewers have been coming here for many, many years? That speaks volumes to the Roman Spa experience. While the rooms and grounds are well maintained, things haven't changed much over time.That's a good thing. It's a wonderful place to come and relax, especially with a small group of friends. My husband and I have been coming here with two other couples for at least 10 years (we know because we used to smuggle a now 13-year old into the pool when she was only 3!). While floating in the warm water, we can make the important decisions about what time to get massages, which wineries to visit and where to walk for dinner. The grounds are lovely and laid out so that groups can hang out together without bothering other guests who prefer to read or nap by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa has Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Hecatos
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Calistoga for years and I very often stay at Roman Spa. They have really nice garden-like decor complete with coy ponds and sun dials that frame nice motel-style rooms. Like the Romans of old, they have three baths: a hot tub that's typically about 105 degrees, a cooler pool heated to around 95 degrees and a warm, indoor pool kept around 100 degrees. The real Romans would have had their cold pool around 40 degrees, but I think most of us would run away from that. :D The rooms are nice. They're clean and serviceable. Each comes with two wine glasses in addition to the usual hotel glasses and a refrigerator, which is a plus. Some of them even have kitchenettes. The service is friendly. I've never had a complaint. They also serve coffee in the mornings. The spa is also real nice with good service and typical Calistoga spa treatments, including mud bathes (if you've never hada mud bath, have one before you die -- you won't believe how nice it is until you have one -- very relaxing). The best part, though, about Roman Spa is the value. It's one of the least expensive places in Calistoga that actually has a spa and hot bathes. I also like the three bath system, because it's not just a hot tub and pool: it's three bathes that are meant to be relaxed in, each at a different temperature, which is kind of unique. Now, is it a top level resort like Indian Springs? I've never been to Indian Springs, but I'd guess not, but then, from what I hear, Indian Springs is the Ritz of Calistoga. There are certainly Ritzier places in Calistoga than Roman Spa, but they're also a lot more expensive and I'm happy with what I get at Roman Spa. Saying it's not like Indian Springs is sort of like complaining that a burger place doesn't serve fillet mignon. Roman Spa is really good for the price you pay and for what it is. I'd say it's one of the better hotels for its value that I've stayed at and that's saying a lot. And, the refrigerator or kitchenette is great, because it means I can buy groceries, eat in and save money. Roman Spa is also right down town, so it's literally with in walking distance of the restaurants, shopping, etc. But, I also seriously enjoy being there. The garden like atmosphere is beautiful and it's a nice place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home - after so many visits it feels like coming home.”
Reviews.Author: OliSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Roman Spa for 15 years. The setting is lovely and relaxing with the hot pools, beautifully maintained gardens and the rooms are always immaculately clean. We of course love the fact that it is in the Napa Valley area and do take advantage of the rooms with kitchens. You can even BBQ on the outside grills provided, with lovely picnic tables in good weather. Coffee service is included in the mornings. When we need to relax and unwind, we love coming here and are so grateful that every time we visit, our stay is wonderful! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Splender at the Spa”
Reviews.Author: Nancyleab
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roman Spa for the past 10 years and everytime it is delightful. The grounds are kept so emaculate and the staff is friendly and professional. They have updated the pool area with new furniture and it has the feel of being in the tropics, with all the palm trees. I highly recommend this to everyone for a fabulous get away.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: travelwise7
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Roman Spa for 20 years. I live less than an hour away, and it is my favorite place in Calistoga for a quick getaway. I do tend to go there on the off season when it is less crowded ( and less expensive). I love soaking in the outdoor hot tub in beautiful and tranquil surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to mellow out - this is the place to go!”
Reviews.Author: vryan25
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly recommend the Roman Spa for anyone who wants to get away from it all. Downtown Calistoga is only one block away so there are lots of great stores and restaurants to visit when you want to take a break from swimming in the nice warm mineral pool. The pool and jacuzzi are fantastic and open from 8 am til 10 pm. Pool side is peaceful and quiet. Great for reading and sunbathing. Lots of chaise lounges. Lots of clean towels. Saunas. Locker rooms. Night swimming is heavenly. The rooms are very clean but pretty standard. They do, however, have refrigerators and there is a great gas grill (which the staff cleans!) -- as well as grilling utensils -- so you can walk uptown and buy shrimp or a steak and eat at the picnic tables in the evenings. Lovely gardens. Coffee in the mornings. No WiFi but a computer in the lobby. The staff were pleasant and knowledgable. I loved every minute of it. One word of caution, if you go on a holiday weekend it does get quite crowded -- but even so, all the guests were nice and having lots of fun, so there is still a great atmosphere...just not as peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Cost to much”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca035
Reviews.Content: I live in CA and so understand hotels out here cost a lot. BUT this place charged be $170 for a non-kitchen suite on a Thursday night. That is what I expect to pay for a nice, cozy place in Calistoga, but the hotel had old rooms and old furnishings. I would look at other hotels in the area if your being cost worrying about cost on your trip. On a good note, it was clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic garden atmosphere with wonderful silky hot water”
Reviews.Author: hotwaterdiva
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are beautiful and the rooms are well outfitted. The best part about my stay was the use of the three natural hot water pools. Plus I had a great massage. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: SplendidOakland
Reviews.Content: I love the Roman Spa, I go once a month for 24 hours! The location is perfect, 1 block off the main drag, I park my car and walk everywhere. Almost all the guests are return customers. There is no need to pay for spa treatments; the koi pond, pools, sauna, beautiful landscaping makes the hotel feel like a spa day in itself. The room is simple and clean, there's free coffee in the am, the people are great.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but beautiful and worth it.”
Reviews.Author: sciencegalsal
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find the hotel looked different that what is pictured in the website. I was a bit worried at first, due to its age- but the clean, impeccably maintained rooms and grounds eased my concerns. The hot spring pool area was spotless and well manicured. The staff friendly for the most part. The rooms although older were clean, and appropriate for the price range. I would recommend this hotel. I did not participate in any of the spa treatments, so I cannot assess their value or quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: DaveandDemi
Reviews.Content: We planned a Saturday night away. We spent barely any time in the hotel. Its clean, servicable, and a short walk to everything downtown. We soaked in the pools also clean. The wife had a massage she throughly enjoyed. The room itself was about the same as any Motel 6, nothing to complain about nothing to rave about. It was less expensive than other places I checked into, and we got what we expected. This is not your romantic hideaway or rejuvinating getaway, its a servicable motel.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: TouristfromSF
Reviews.Content: Architecturally, Roman Spa looks like a charmless run of the mill two story motel tarted up with some landscaping. The room was perfectly clean and serviceable, and came with a kitchenette useful for reheating yesterday's leftovers when we were too tired to go out to eat. From previous reviews, I was expecting actual landscaping, with lawns, but instead, for example, the swimming pool had lots of trees and bushes on the concrete instead of just a concrete surround. Nice, but nothing to write home about. The location was perfect in that it was one block off the main street, which made it both quiet and convenient. There weren't really three pools, just one, with the equivalent of an indoor and outdoor hot tub. I think how you regard the place depends on what you're used to. It's not a five star resort. But it's completely serviceable if all you want is someplace to stay in between spa treatments. St. Helena is much more upscale for shopping, and if you're doing wine country, you're better off with the charm of a B and B.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Oasis”
Reviews.Author: DAElkGrove
Reviews.Content: Loved the peaceful shaded courtyard areas throughout and access to BBQ's in each. My husband really got to unwind and relax and can't wait to come back again. Walking distance to great food and shopping. DA, Elk Grove, CA

Reviews.Title: “relax, relax, relax.....”
Reviews.Author: BuffyBuffington
Reviews.Content: I have traveled yearly to Roman Spas with the same friends for more than 20 years. There is no place more relaxing! The rooms are nicely decorated, always immaculate, and we enjoy having a kitchen. The grounds are lush and beautiful, flowers and palm trees abound. There is a barbeque area, a spa is on the grounds, a sauna and three mineral pools are available. The town of Calistoga is charming and everything is in walking distance, great restaurants, cute shops. I can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenate in the center of Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: vagrant13
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa is an excellent place to stay in the center of Calistoga. We have stayed many times and will stay many times in the future. The nice relaxing pools and hot tub are kept clean and quiet. The landscaping around the complex is very well-kept....with plenty of palm trees to take you away. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, but not elegant. Many Calistoga attractions are within walking distance; including restaurants, cafes, and wine tasting rooms. You will not be disappointed if you choose the Roman Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Do as the Romans”
Reviews.Author: italianfun
Reviews.Content: I have been to this resort a few times now. It just keeps getting better. They recentaly just added the mud baths and spa which now you never have to leave the resort. We stayed in the kitchette style rooms. We enjoyed having that convience of a kitchen in our room. The gardens and the 3 pools are what makes this place so tranqul. The grounds are beautiful and so quiet. The staff is wonderful and so nice. They were very accomodating. The grounds also boast beautiful gas grills as long as charcol ones too. This is wonderful for big groups or reunions. The tables are always clean and so are the pool areas. I would reccomend this place to anyone who wants some peace and quiet. They are just one block over from the main drag, so walking is always an option. Come and feel spoiled like the Roman Gods. I will be traveling back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: AlaninBC
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Roman Spa on our honeymoon and had a most wonderful time. Be aware - this is not one of the big hotel chains so no fancy high tech facilities, no wi-Fi and no restaurant What you do get is VERY comfortable accommodation, kitchenette - excellent little supermarket around the corner so you can eat in (Healthier & cheaper) without restrictions on menus etc. The staff were helpful and friendly and the spa is for being thoroughly spoiled! And the location is close to everything

Reviews.Title: “The Roman Spa Resort Reunion”
Reviews.Author: wfollin
Reviews.Content: My sisters (all five of them) and I make a yearly reunion to the Roman Spa Resort. Even living so close to one another in San Francisco, our lives are so busy that we hardly get to see each other, but this is one reunion that no one cancels out on. Weâ€™ve been going to the Roman Spa Resort for our yearly three-day weekend for six years. The rooms are pleasant and comfortable and we always reserve rooms with kitchens so that we can prepare breakfast and eat out in the beautiful garden and lunch at the picnic area so that we can barbeque. The pools are wonderful (both indoor and outdoor) where you can relax all day â€“ in fact, until 10:00 at night, and the sauna and dressing rooms at the pool are impeccable! To us, it is always a good sign when we meet other fellow Roman Spa regulars and to see the same pleasant, friendly faces of the staff year after year. Good job Roman Spa Resort and thank you and youâ€¦â€¦..See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice mineral spas, older rooms, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Goodtimes2
Reviews.Content: Check-in staff is unfriendly, uninformative and didn't even offer a towel when I was in my bathing suit inquiring about where the indoor spa was located, so I had to come back in wet to get one later on. You can't bet the location being only a few steps from numerous resturants, bars, and shops. The mineral pools are comfortable and it was very nice to have the option of the indoor pool when it rained. Our room was very old, but comfortable and when the toliet broke, it was fixed , although had intermittant problems that we did not report. Priced high for accomodations and ammenities, but I guess you're paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandLisa
Reviews.Content: On this trip to the Roman Spa, it was just the girls. We had a wonderful, relaxing time swimming in the mineral pools. We took a drive to visit the local Indian casino and won! We also had mud baths, mineral whirlpools and wraps. The food was remarkable. If you want to "get away from it all", this is the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Low Key, Relaxed but In Serious Need of Updating”
Reviews.Author: Pappy_T_Wilson
Reviews.Content: I love the Roman Hot Springs. It's clientel is mosly in their 60s and up, but that's what makes it relaxing and unpretentious. It's a great location, walking distance (like 2 minutes) to down town with an excellent coffee shop right across the street. The place needs serious updating -- the rooms feel like rest home rooms styled like it's1974. For this reason, it's not a good value at all. It's way too pricey to not have any re-investment done on it. If you're looking for modern luxury, hit up the Indian Springs. If you are looking for low key, relaxed and to feel really really young (if your under 60 years old), hit up the Roman Hot Springs

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would come back!”
Reviews.Author: HamurgerDeern
Reviews.Content: Great location! We were already on our way back home and decided spontaneous to stay one night in Calistoga. We had a great time at the Roman Spa. Everything was very clean. The staff was all helpful and friendly. A variety of breakfast, lunch and dinner places are in walking distance. The natural hot spring pool and spa were just gorgeous. Our whole family had a very enjoyable and relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Yendeau
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days and each day was terrific. Pools were clean, warm and relaxing. The groundskeeper and other workers are really friendly. We greatly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: Belen2009
Reviews.Content: The location along with the amenities makes this a great location for a first time stay in the Calistoga area. We were able to walk to restaurants and shopping. The Spa treatments were very nice and comfortable. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “If you really want to relax your mind and body”
Reviews.Author: kenjiSanRafael
Reviews.Content: Last weekend was our second trip since our New Year's eve trip. Spring added a bonus of green hills and wildflowers on our hike on the nearby Oat Hill Mine trail. The hotel is not fancy but it is clean and welcoming to guests of all ages. What was evident both times was the friendly nature of all the guests and the number of locals that are regulars to this particular resort. There are three soaking pools of differing temperatures, all very relaxing to stay in. People read, sip on wine or other beverages, sit by the pool, talk with each other making new friends. Next door is the Roman Spa where we got a massage on both days and had the same therapists from our last trip. Excellent massages on both days. It is hard to imagine anything more relaxing to the mind and body; soaking in warm pools of water, getting a total body massage and then returning to the pools with a cool drink , perhaps a nice white wine from nearby Napa. As night falls you see the stars above. It is a short walk to all the fine restaurants in town. The ambiance is gentle and quiet and refined. We ate at Checkers which , at first glance, looks like a diner for a quick burger and pizza. We had roasted garlic, salmon with spinich, and angel hair pasta with shrimp that was outstanding. $5 for for a merlot special. We hiked on Saturday and saw over 20 different kinds of wildflowers on the trail. The views were fantastic. For a weekend of massage and hotel and dinner the event is definitely a splurge but well worth it. My wife had just finished two months of radiation therapy for cancer and we were celebrating her diagnosis of a complete cure. I could think of no better way to celebrate.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back again...”
Reviews.Author: just4fun_roadtrip
Reviews.Content: Weather was superb. Location was great... we walked to breakfast and dinner. The spa next door was very convenient. The natural hot spring pool, spa were great, as was the dry sauna. It would be nice if there was an exercise room. I missed not having wifi anywhere within the resort.

Reviews.Title: “this is an older, very charming, unpretensious Spa/Retreat”
Reviews.Author: chrissyinCA
Reviews.Content: Yes, The Roman Spa is older. I have been coming here since the early 80's. Believe me, it has blossomed into a wonderful get a way oasis. I know the front desk accommodates people who do not care for their rooms. Ask to be moved, simple. I have been to every Spa in Calistoga. The gardens are beautiful. It is the end of March and tulips were in full bloom. I love the little courtyard areas. The BBQ area is a fabulous idea. The fountain tucked away in the back with the fish is serene. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the pool. It was nice. But then again, I know this place is older and I accept that. The walls are thin and the TV next door a bit loud. They did turn it off at midnight. The fact that it is walking distance, 1 block, to groceries and fine dining is wonderful. I do go elsewhere for the Spa treatments. Another Spa that also has been around forever. Tried and true. What I love about this place is that it is not just all on concrete like another one down the road. This has greenery, sun or shade spots. The people who stayed here are unpretentious and authentic.m We loved our recent stay here and will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely best bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: Leafley
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Roman Spa on and off for the last fifteen years and they are consistently excellent. Imagine a Motel 6 with beautifully maintained, abundant gardens, barbeque and picnic areas and a welcoming, gracious staff that has changed very little over the years. The rooms are comfortable and super clean as are the jacuzzi and pool. I especially appreciate the large (20+ x 10+ feet?) indoor jacuzzi that protects you from cold winter rains and excessive summer heat. And floating on your back in the warm outdoor pool gazing up at the palms can't be beat. It's just a block off Calistoga's main drag so everything (lattes, supermarket, shops etc) is within easy walking distance. It seems just right for families, small reunions, couples, you name it. It is rare, in my experience, to find such a constellation of pluses for such a reasonable price, especially appreciated in these difficult economic times. I always feel wonderfully relaxed while there and afterward. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Grown-Ups Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 2manyhorses
Reviews.Content: There's something noble about the Roman Spa, a sense of dignity that pervades the place and seems to rub off on the clientele. This is no noisy party scene. The waters in the two pools feel like velvet against the skin. I'm no fan of mudbaths and I can get all the bodywork I want right here where I live, so most of my time there is spent soaking. We haven't stayed at every spa in Calisoga but so far, the pools at the Roman Spa get our vote as the best, period. And they're clean, which is really important to me. Recently, I spent a weekend there with my two grown daughters and they were captured by the place. This is an ideal spot to stage a mother-daughter weekend. But be advised, the Roman Spa discourages small children and even bans children under four from the pools. I don't mind that, this is a special retreat for grown-ups and those aspiring to be one. Besides, the town and all that goes with it is just steps outside the walled and laviously planted courtyards.

Reviews.Title: “Liars!!!”
Reviews.Author: sasafracas
Reviews.Content: This place makes one wonder if there are any rules about what can and canâ€™t be called a â€œresortâ€� or a â€œspaâ€�. This was just a run-down motel with a swimming pool and rude staff. The â€œgarden areaâ€� is just a few potted plants and a fountain. The â€œspaâ€� treatment was a joke. The mud bath is just sloshy potting soil, and the mineral bath is just a small bathtub filled with tap water with an inflatable pillow. (BTW â€“ if you are over 5â€™5â€� your legs will be sticking out of the tub!) And the people at the spa have no shame! We left the requested gratuity but apparently that wasnâ€™t enough â€“ they called us on our cell phone to leave a message that they wanted a bigger tip!!! WTF?! Other issues â€“ we were put in a room overlooking the ghetto across the street where there was loud music playing and the garbage truck came by at 5 AM. The front desk staff doesnâ€™t answer the phone until it rings a dozen times and then are not interested in helping you. Also, the â€œpackagesâ€� are a lie! We saved $8 on a $450 package â€“ we could have found our own food and spa treatments when we got there for much cheaper (the â€œpackageâ€� rate is not discounted â€“ but there are all sorts of discounts when you get there). This place would be OK for $50 a night but for $120 â€“ save your money and go somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: KaylaXcalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Roman Spa was both relaxing and refreshing. Our whole family went and we all had a great time including the kids. The rooms where very clean, the staff was very friendly and helpfull, and the pools where just perfect. This is definitely a place that I will return to year after year even in the winter. I Wilburn, Northern California

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful warm pools”
Reviews.Author: MarieSunflower
Reviews.Content: When my mother told me we were going to the Roman Spa to soak in natural mineral tubs, I had no idea just how lovely it would be. The three pools run from regular "hot tub size" and quite warm-- to the sizeable "swimming pool size" pool outside. I was in heaven. As I very much enjoy simply relaxing in the water, the pools are idyllic. I found all very comfortable, and relaxing, as well as stimulating---when moving from one to the next! The landscaping of the Roman Spa is expertly done. It is beautiful! The colors are vivid, truly stunning. We loved the blue toned spruce trees, and flower-lined paths. It is a real pleasure to lounge in the pool area. We also found the other guests generally very "down to earth" and friendly. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The rooms were nice, and very clean. Our bed was particularly comfortable. As others have mentioned, the location is perfect. You are a block from downtown, and kitty-corner from a uniquely done, and cozy cafe that serves organic fair trade coffee, and has funny quotes on the walls. The Roman Spa is also literally across the street from the Calistoga Museum, a rare treat, and window into the cities fascinating history! --And it's free! (donation if you like;) Suffice to say, we enjoyed our jaunts around this lovely town. I highly recommend the Roman Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Culinaryvixen
Reviews.Content: Have one night to spend in wine country but want to feel like you've been gone for the whole weekend? The Roman Spa offers a romantic and fast getaway from San Francisco. My sweetie and I took a leisurely drive and stopped at many of the fabulous wineries in Carneros (Cline, Gloria Ferrer, and Domaine Carneros) on the way up. We checked in to find gorgeous flowers all over the property (even in the dead of January), then walked the one block over to the main street of Calistoga and had a quiet romantic dinner. We then indulged in the outdoor mineral baths just a few yards from our room. While they have an indoor pool as well, we preferred the outside pool which allows you to look up at the starry sky and the beautiful palm trees. Can you say romantic? The only thing that could have made it more perfect is if there had been robes in the room. It was pretty cold dashing back in our wet swimsuits. The next day we had a lovely breakfast at Cafe Sarafornia before putting the top down on the converitible and heading north a few miles to the Old Faithful Geyser, back south again to check out the Culinary Institute and then have our choice of visiting several of the bizillion wineries on the way back down through Napa. Other goodies: You can book massages and mud baths in their spa which is just next door, plenty of clean fluffy towels, refrigerator and blow dryer in the room, gurgling fountain on the patio outside which makes for a peaceful sleep. Lastly, this is one of the few places in wine country that doesn't require a two night minimum. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “new person after leaving”
Reviews.Author: slowbud
Reviews.Content: After the chaos of the holidays, my husband and I needed to rejuvinate ourselves and spend some quality alone time. After two nites, and many hours of soaking in their immaculately clean mineral baths, we left totally new persons. We return to this hotel once a year (for about ten years)and realize we need to go more often. The gardens are beautifully kept, the rooms impeccably clean, the beds extremely comfortable, and with the winter specials that are offered, this has become our number one bay area getaway.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Fun”
Reviews.Author: AJoyRoseville_CA
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit and my boyfriend's 5th visit to Roman Spa. We actually extended our stay by 2 days because we were enjoying ourselves so much. The pools were clean and well maintained. The location is perfect; there are many shops and restaurants to keep you occupied if you can drag yourself away from the pools. Our room had a new mattress that was very comfortable. The rooms were well maintained. The grounds include a really nice and clean gas BBQ with tools for guest to use. The staff and owner were pleasant and open to our feedback regarding an incident with some noisy children. We plan to return to Roman Spa soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine stay at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: bcra91
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been coming to the Roman Spa for approximately 8 years. Every New Years we come for a four day visit. We spend a great deal of time in and around the hot spring fed pools and jacuzzi's. The staff has essentially remained the same throughout the time we have been coming to the the Roman Spa. They are friendly and helpful. While young family members are welcome the Roman Spa encourages these youngsters to behave themselves in and around the pool areas so as to not disprupt the serenity of the grounds. The rooms are clean, modern, and are kept up. There are kitchenettes in some units, kitchens in others, and some just have a microwave & small refrigerator. There is no free WiFi internet available which is something that I would encourage the Roman Spa to take a look at adding in the future. However they do have a PC in the lobby for guests to check their emails, which is a good alternative. The actual Spa treatments are next door and the one thing I would encourage is for a small price break for spa treatments to Roman Spa Resort guests. As it is folks that come in off the street pay the same rates for spa treatments as resort guests. My suggestion is make it more enticing for a resort guest to do a spa treatment especially ones that are staying multiple nights. All in all, I have no complaints. The Resort is very clean, the grounds and landscaping are fantastic, with a Spanish/Mission style motif. There is adequate parking and everything in town is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: GVTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two teenage daughters stayed overnight to "take the waters". It was clean and comfortable. The 3 pools were all well maintained and relaxing. Though we did not use them, they had nice picnicing/outdoor dining tables in their courtyard with grills available to use. We had two rooms with a fridge, both clean and functional. My girls and I had massages at the adjoining spa and they were nice. The location is great. Close to the downtown and the restaurants and shops so we could walk. We had appetizers at the Chinese restaurant and then cocktails and calamari at Brannan's and then pizza and salads at Bosko's. Fun and a way to kill an evening with some teenagers in a quiet town.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. not great”
Reviews.Author: MikeHoustonTexas
Reviews.Content: The pools were nice and relaxing. You can walk to the grocery store which is right around the corner and to main street where all of the shops and restaraunts are. What absolutely amazes me and what always amazes me in hotels that are designed and cater to tourists is the attitude and the lack of knowledge of front desk personnel. These people at the Roman Spa did not know where to go/do and it seemed like they were from another planet, let alone the local area (I assume). It would not take much to give the front desk staff a little training on hotel hospitality. Rooms were basic. It was a nice stay. Area is beautiful....just figure out where you want to go before you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Two days at Roman Spa...PRICELESS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanbuff
Reviews.Content: This was our second year at Roman Spa and it was as wonderful as the prior year! This time we had our adult daughter meet us for Thanksgiving and had the most unestressed holiday we could have ever imagined! The staff is always corteous, the hotel is imaculate and it is close to all restaurants!! We will be visiting Roman Spa for many years to come!!

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: SFcityslicker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I could feel the stress melting away as we soaked in the mineral pool, the jacuzzi and had the couples massages. It was so relaxing and calm and we swore to do this again soon. The staff was so welcoming and the resort is in the perfect location , a 2 minute walk to main St. Calistoga. Rooms are clean and spacious and the rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa Reward”
Reviews.Author: halibutman
Reviews.Content: Roman Spa Reward After all, you deserve a reward! By Earl F. Martinelli Immerse, plunge, dip, slither, dive, plummet or ease into the hot pools at Roman Spa in Calistoga, California. We (Mollie, my wife and I) live in San Francisco, a great reward in itself, and travel to Roman Spa three to four times a year. The drive is short, about one and a half hours, if you can resist stopping in at all the wineries along the way. Once at Roman Spa, quickly check in to your room (a room booking is required to use the spas), get a spa towel and head off for the mid-temperature, indoor spa. The sore lower back and joints of this old man love those massaging jets. After a few minutes, amble the few feet to the small, hotter outdoor pool. Oh, this is living, more massaging jets. Then, for a change, slip into the large, temperate swimming pool. Rest your neck against the smooth coping of that temperate swimming pool and you may see some of the restful sights Iâ€™ve seen over the years. In the early morning, colorful hot air balloons drift by as they weave in and out of sight against the tall palm trees on the spa property. In the early evening, the fronds of the palm trees dance lightly in the breeze. You are apt to see hummingbirds flitting about feeders located on the beautiful grape arbor walkway that parallels the length of the large pool. Lounge on deck sunning chairs and read for a while. Barbeques are provided for guests use. A loaf of bread, a jug of wine and thouâ€¦ you know, the essence of contentment. Many umbrella picnic tables abound. The rooms are clean, the surroundings pleasant and so peaceful. Mud baths and massages are located on the eastern side of the premises. Have I left anything out? Parking is no problem. Oh yes, the dining around Calistoga is as easy as walking two blocks to several downtown gastronomic choices. Wineries nearby are too numerous to mention; just pick up a brochure from the Spa office. Two state parks and Mt. St. Helena are nearby too. Roman Spa has bed and breakfast packages and a wedding package. The Sharpsteen Museum is a block away; itâ€™s worthy of a visit if you can bear abandoning those massaging jets. Go ahead; reward yourself. Address: 1300 Washington Street, Calistoga, CA 94515 Web: http://www.romanspahotsprings.com/ Phone: [-]

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa is an oasis”
Reviews.Author: KR95117
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa in Calistoga is a wonderful oasis with lush plants and very friendly service. I have stayed here several times and it is always a pleasure

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: Ca200959
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort three times and I have not been disappointed. The resort is beautiful, clean & very relaxing. The rooms are spacious, clean and the amenities are wonderful. The hotel is situated right in the middle of the quaint town of Calistoga with so much to see and do from wine tasting, shopping, and enjoying a massage or facial. I would highly recommend this spot with one exception, the office staff can sometimes come off as being a little unfriendly and unaccommodating., oherwise, it a winner.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: chubbsCarmichael_Ca
Reviews.Content: My daughter, three of her friends, and Mother (me) traveled to the wine country for three days of wonderful good food,refreshing body treatments and total relaxation. The Roman Spa is truly a remarkable experience for adults. The rooms are emaculate and well appointed and the three therapy pools also beautifully kept with grounds and flowers to equal the islands. We were able to barbeque our meals and dine elegantly. Thank you Roman Spa!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ahh at the Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily0323
Reviews.Content: Ahh at the Roman Spa. From the moment we arrived "ahh" was murmurred repeatedly by myself and the three friends I was traveling with. Ahh at the beautiful grounds, ahh at the very clean and pleasantly decorated rooms, ahh as we first dipped into one heated mineral pool and ahh as we dipped into another. Ahh as we relaxed at tables outside our door in a tropical courtyard setting and sipped our wine. Ahh as we relaxed into our beds and slept soundly. Ahh as we awoke the next morning realizing we had the luxury to enjoy another ahh filled day. Our second day included spa-ahh treatments, located literally across a driveway - which is very convenient, as you can wear your bathrobe to and from the appointment and are able to return to your room thoroughly relaxed after a heavenly massage. Even as we departed from the Roman Spa after our wonderful two nights, we still had the ahh feeling. And on our drive home, we contemplated when we could return for another ahh visit.

Reviews.Title: “Longtime guest”
Reviews.Author: greenhillOakland_Ca
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have been enjoying the Roman Spa for over two decades now, and it does not disappoint. The staff is friendly and the maid service is efficient (we were gone for an hour for breakfast and by the time we returned the room was cleaned). The three spa pools offer different temperatures (large outdoor pool is 92-95 degrees, the medium indoor pool about 100 degrees, and the small outdoor jacuzzi is 104 degrees). There are also separate men's and women's saunas. While the rooms could use a style update, ours was clean and had a small but nice bathroom. Our room had a kitchenette which was convenient, but since the spa is located only steps away from a variety of restaurants (high, medium and low end), we just used it for the refrigerator and early morning coffee. What has always been the draw for us, besides the pools, is the landscaping. There beautiful dark wood vine arbors and there are always seasonal plantings. At this time of year, the mums are plentiful. Pumpkins had been placed abundantly in the gardens, including a monster big one outiside the office door. I was hoping for cooler fall weather, but had to live with glorious, sunny mid 80s weather during my stay. Oh well, that just means coming back again later this winter when I can count on a chill in the air even mid-day.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: css201
Reviews.Content: As part of a 2 week road trip, we were only in town for one night. The Roman Spa provided a nice relaxing break and had all the facilities we needed. We did feel like the youngest people by about 30 years though!

Reviews.Title: “Long Time Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Jintei
Reviews.Content: We live in Ashland Oregon and often visit family in the San Francisco Bay Area. We stopped in Calistoga some 17 years ago on our way home from SF and stayed at the Roman Spa. We so enjoyed the beautiful grounds and the 3 mineral pools that we make it a point to visit at least once and sometimes twice a year. The Roman Spa and Calistoga is our favorite spot in the Wine Country.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: icp_professsor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were coming to this gem for over 10 years. This is a great place for a weekend getaway in the Wine Country. Unobtrusive and helpful staff, clean rooms, sauna and mineral pools, nice courtyards - everything you need to recuperate in a very short period of time at a price that is hard to beat. I hope this place sticks to the tried and successful business model for years to come. Will hate to see it turn into another overpriced snobby spa.

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: tkgatrp
Reviews.Content: My mother and I always atay at the Roman Spa when we visit Calistoga. We enjoy the pools tremendously and the grounds and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Escape to a Roman Spa”
Reviews.Author: 333skeeter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recent first-time guests at the Roman Spa Resort in Calistoga, and found it to be a great getaway destination for rest and relaxation. It is located within easy walking distance of the downtown restaurants and shops. The staff was friendly and helpful; the grounds and rooms attractive and well-maintained; and, the heated pool and saunas provided a pleasant atmosphere in which to unwind and relax. Our overall impression was very favorable and we look forward to a return visit within the not-too-distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Growing old gracefully!”
Reviews.Author: muletrains
Reviews.Content: A somewhat 'shabby-chic' resort reminescent of the Caribbean which is popular with seniors and has probably seen better days. It could do with freshening up. The rooms are average, clean but tired with a stained. cracked sink in our bathroom. The 3 hot spring pools have cracked, stained paving around them. The gardens though are well kept and provide shaded areas among the flowers to relax. However at a total of $140 (inc tax) per night for a 2 queen room which had no coffee maker, no microwave, no internet access and no breakfast, it does not offer much. Coffee is put out in the morning only in the lobby otherwise you need to go to restaurants for all meals. An interesting place to visit but you feel it could do so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the water”
Reviews.Author: Stockton_CABulldog
Reviews.Content: Nestled in the quiet, and quaint Napa Valley. We arrived in Calistoga, CA at our destination, The Roman Spa, Hot springs resort. The weather was perfect. Sundown, relatively warm. Checked in to find a nice, clean, hotel room. The hotel grounds were nicely manicured. The three therapy pools, each of different temperatures allowed us to pick, and choose. The small outdoor spa, with jets was the best, and the hottest. We really enjoyed the water. One of the most disturbing, not the facility, but other guests did alot of smoking. Overall a pleasant experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Getaway, Not A Looker”
Reviews.Author: Coalinga
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our 30's and we were looking for a reasonable getaway. in wine country away from the kids While the Roman Inn & Spa is reasonable, I just dind't feel pampered by the overall look of the hotel. The decor is very 80's. I guess you could say, it wasn't anything special. Don't get me wrong, the hotel staff was very friendly and we did not have time for the Spa, so I can't rate that. The hotel is in walking distance from Calistoga, but if you're looking for shopping and a bit more "Swank Factor" I would recommend St. Helena. Now, if you just need a place to sleep, the hotel is okay, but there are NO FRILLS.

Reviews.Title: “So Relaxing I Forgot What Day It Was!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marie041
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fabulous time at the Roman Spa in Calistoga. I needed a break from the 9-5 grind, and this was perfect. I honestly felt so relaxed there that I forgot what day it was. I even let my cell phone battery fizzle out because I couldn't find my charger and I didn't even care! I found the charger while I was packing to leave, it was in my suitcase, silly me. I woke up early every morning and loved to just sit on the chaise lounge chairs and watch the hummingbirds fly about. The landscaping is beautiful at the spa, and well-tended. I love sitting next to the water fountain, looking at the flowers and relaxing. The pools were the perfect temperature. I loved floating around under the moon and stars. The sauna also helped me to relax. All the staff were super friendly and helpful. And there was internet access in the lobby where I checked my email a few times. I didn't drive at all, as the restaurants are all within walking distance. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing spa and lodging!”
Reviews.Author: celloheidi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at the Roman Spa. We had a very relaxing and happy visit there. The rooms, grounds, pools and spa are a perfect place to rest and rejuvenate. The staff people are very pleasant and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean. Our only recommendation and thoughts for improvement is that they provide a coffee maker and microwave in the room. These are increasingly becoming standard fare in more and more hotels and motels. Our room included a kitchen area with refrigerator and stove; but there were no cooking tools, plates or utensils provided rendering it useless. The grounds are very lovely and well-maintained with three pools of varying sizes and temperatures. We enjoyed just relaxing in and out of the water for hours. The thermal waters here are definitely therapeutic. The spa has been remodeled in recent years and is very attractive and serene. We had excellent massages by Kelly and Matt after our mud treatment and cool down. The experience was great as always. We will definitely come back to Roman Spa for the a stay and spa treatments, and enjoy the lovely environment at the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot for a day or two”
Reviews.Author: cbotc3
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for two nights while touring Napa wineries. We were a bit disappointed with the room at first, average at best. But, the pools, spas, and spa treatments were relaxing and wonderful. tables and grills around the pool area were really nice. The rooms were nothing special but, they were clean and the service was very good. We called down for and iron and ironing board and int arrived in minutes. More for couples and so much for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: tonmessina
Reviews.Content: Five years ago we booked this spa for two nights on a long California trip. We extended it another two days. It was perfect. Just a block off the Main Street, surrounded with many good restaurants, winerys, things to do. Cullinary Institute of America just about 15 mins down the road. Great location for many day trips. Good hiking areas all arround. Hotel rooms are clean and roomy. Grounds and mineral pools are well kept. Makes for a wonderful holiday no matter what the weather does. Efficiencies are great. They have washer and dryer facility. Clientel mostly settled down folks, many have been coming here for years. Not the place for young children or young adults looking for an exciting time. This will be our fifth stay of at least 10 days and Ive never seen a lack of clients, probably because of the care and control the hotel offers its guests. We used to go to Maine, which we miss because we love the Lobster and steamers, but we did get frozen and wet many times. We come from Florida so its a long trip either way. Flying into either San Francisco, Oakland or Sacramento its still about 75 miles or so but we love the place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Landscaping”
Reviews.Author: amphibolostylous
Reviews.Content: The prices are affordable, the staff friendly, and the hotel is centrally located. The most amazing aspect is the landscaping, with colorful flowers and greenery that no other hotel in that area offers. The grounds themselves are so comfortable and welcoming they become part of your vacation pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: fifibugz
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff are so lovely and helpfull and were great to deal with. Being a relaxation resort, it was peaceful and tranquil. The Spa offered Mineral and Mud baths, (the main attraction to this area) and a pool side chair masage was offered most days which was just wonderful. The mineral pools were open from 8am til 10pm which meant you could freshen up in the morning and wind down before bed which we just loved. My partner spent most of the holiday in the pools!!! Although the Hotel doesn't offer food, there is a BBQ area which you can use and there are plenty of good restaurants just round the corner including a good supermarket. The rooms were very clean and the service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Eurotravel
Reviews.Content: We were driving through the area and thought that Calistoga would be a nice place to stop for one night. The Roman Spa is a decent place to stay but is not a resort by any stretch of the imagination. It's an old establishment and shows it, but generally is comfortable. The rooms are updated, but the air conditioning unit is dismal. It was impossible to find a good setting during the night, it was either too cold, but when you turned it up a bit, you woke up sweating. Lots of older couples there which I thought was endearing. The baths are quite old and the tiles are fading badly, but that didn't seem to bother anyone. The reception and service seems to be an afterthought for those who work there. With the exception of a nice young lady, they would just let you stand at the counter indefinitely as they walked back and forth doing "their work". It's okay for one night, but I didn't feel it lived up to it's description on the website.

Reviews.Title: “It was 'OK'”
Reviews.Author: jschwan
Reviews.Content: We checked in and things were fine, people at the front desk were nice and helpful. It is a block off the main street with a ton of places to eat, so that was nice. When we got to the room, the door was open - wide open, which I think was strange. The room was very clean. It needs an update, new decor, the whole 9. The room was also dark, even with the curtains open, so we had to have lights on all the time. The bed was HARD! I had to toss and turn because my sides and back would hurt. The grounds were nice. Lots of plants everywhere. We went in the "mineral pools" but there was a strong chlorine smell, so we didn't stay in very long, plus there were kids everywhere, so it was hard to just relax and enjoy the warm water. There were a lot of families with children, which was fine, but they were running amok all over. I over heard a conversation with a hotel staff member and a guest, and apparently someone let their kids sleep in the car in the parking lot all night! All in all the stay was OK... I am not happy I paid almost $200 for 1 night, but it was Memorial Day weekend... The website made the place look like a resort, and I must say... it is FAR from a resort! I would stay again, but I would never pay that much again!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa Great get away”
Reviews.Author: soroity
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I have been going to the Roman Spa for about 10 years now. We have always had a wonderful time. The people in the office have always been very helpful and have accommadated our wishes. It is a wonderful place to go and just relax and enjoy a massage or a facial etc. It is a little in need of some renovations but is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pools were great; room was a basic motel room.”
Reviews.Author: PHamlen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an overnight stay at Roman Spa. The pools were everything we wanted. Both my wife and I ended up soaking in the multiple times over both days. I was not a big believer in "mineral pools" beforehand but I have to say - they are really relaxing. The rooms themselves were nothing special: typical motel rooms. Really, it felt like a typical motel with these neat pools more than anything else. Everything was clean, though, and all the appliances, plumbing, etc. worked well. Staff was good, giving us extra towels, helping us find some restaurants, etc. Overall, not a bad place to stay and pretty relaxing - but definitely not a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If This Is A Resort Then I'm The TOOTH FAIRY”
Reviews.Author: TJANDLJ
Reviews.Content: I wasn't aware that one can so easily paste the words "resort" and "spa" on random shacks...The Roman Spa Hot Springs and Resort is an ill-played farce- to put it nicely. I booked reservations for 2 nights for Mother's Day weekend after seeing this "resort's" webpage and all of the glowing reviews on said page. I asked for accomodations big enough for 3 people; myself, my husband, and my mother in-law. I was promised a room with 2 queens and a full kitchen. What we got was 1 small queen bed and a LOVELY twin size bed! Our full kitchen was pathetically tiny and outdated. Not to mention, there weren't any real coffee cups, but I guess the staff at this "resort" don't expect anyone to drink coffee anyhow because there wasn't any in our "suite". As for the daily maid service, I suppose you can't expect too great of service at a "luxury resort" right? Their kind service apparently didn't include new towels after 1 day, or new shampoo (which was so cheap I wouldn't even use it on my pets), we didn't even get our cups washed or replaced, just left in the sink. But on the bright side, our queen and twin beds were made when we returned to our "resort". The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort boasts on their website: "This delightful hotel and hot springs resort is a unique blend of Napa Valley style and warm hospitality in a captivating locale." They should really rephrase this on their website to read "our MOTEL hasn't had any upgrades since the 70's, our staff doesn't even know how to spell the words customer service, so don't expect a lot, our enchanting garden boasts potted flowers from the dollar store, our ice machine is on the fritz indefinitely, our thin walls make for a cozy experience with your neighbor, but hey- at least we only charge $225.00 a night! Enjoy your stay and don't mind the manager's building out back with the wood scraps dangling off the balcony! Needless to say, I will NEVER return to this tourist trap again and I hope that by reading this I'm saving your wallet too! Forget staying in Calistoga- come here for dinner at Brannan's (INCREDIBLE FOOD) but sleep and spa in Sonoma!! Make yourself and your mother in-law happy, trust me...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kga19
Reviews.Content: My friend chose Roman Spa for a girls weekend getaway. The hotel is super close to restaurants and shopping and we walked everywhere. I liked the pools, gardens and fountains. It was very comfortable and clean, and we plan to stay there again next year! A really good value!

Reviews.Title: “Going Again”
Reviews.Author: johns33
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a visit to the Roman Spa in Calistoga refreshed and eager to go again. Our accomodations were comfortable and the water warm was relaxing and invigorating. We cooked our own steaks on the well maintained outdoor grill and met many fine people of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “out of order room”
Reviews.Author: 1unhappylady
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving after our 3 hour 85 degree road trip I was welcomed with," oh we've been waiting for you. Unfortunately your confirmed room is "out of order" no other rooms are available". I asked "why didn't you call and advise me of this so I didn't waste a trip up here with gas prices being the way they are". Their reply: we tried. Of course I never received such a call. I was then told that we'd been booked into a hotel a half mile away, with no pool.( the main purpose was the mineral pools) I was told that we were more than welcome to drive and use Roman Spa's pools, of course. There were no other vacant hotels with mineral pools. We ended up leaving and returning home another 3 hours away

Reviews.Title: “The Spa AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH”
Reviews.Author: jeddy007
Reviews.Content: Have always stayed at the Roman Spa, and have always been pleased with the courtesy of the employees & how clean & tidy the rooms & grounds are. It is also close to downtown & you can walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: danygrl10
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a weekend get away, it's a block from the main drag in Calistoga. It has small outdated kitchens but the hotsprings, bbq area and great service make up for that! A great place for the connivence and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: karnps
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Roman Spa a couple of times of year. For us, it is the kind of place that you do not want to recommend for fear that droves of people will also want to stay there. But, honestly, it is a very clean property, the owners and staff are friendly and could not be more accomodating. The property has 2 pools and a hot tub fed by the hot springs and there are grills available for everyone to use. It is conveniently located in downtown so you can walk to the many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne4
Reviews.Content: My kids and I go to the Roman Spa at least once a year. It's relaxing for me and a treat for the kids. Calistoga in general is an adult destination for honeymoon couples and wedding parties, and wine tasters. At the Roman Spa, we've found a place where kids are welcome too. We usually get a kitchenette and hang around the warm mineral pools for most of our visit. The rooms are clean and there are always hundreds of flowers blooming on the grounds of the hotel. It's a nice retreat for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased Again!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchyTahoeCity_CA
Reviews.Content: April 11, 2008 Sue Duvall Rossi We should be in Kauai right now. Yes, we are part of history, Airline history. April 7th to 14th in a free condo and ATA Airlines went under. So, we thought of Calistoga and the Roman Spa. The Roman Spa is the only place we ever stay, coming almost every year when we can. We love the proximity to Main St. and all the restuarants and shopping. We absoutly love the lush and beautiful gardens the pools and piece and Quite. Highly Suggest you come and Enjoy, Sue Duvall Rossi

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tulips”
Reviews.Author: mariaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a couple of restful days at the Roman Spa in Calistoga. The gardens filled with pots of tulips enhanced the clean and comfortable environment.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Spa, a joy in any season”
Reviews.Author: argonaut-girl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Roman Spa numerous times since the early 80's. It has never failed to be the most relaxing getaway in the wine country. The rooms are spacious and always immaculate. The employees will do whatever it takes to make your stay a memorable occasion. When we go in the winter we use the indoor pool so the weather can do whatever and we still can relax. In the spring you can lounge poolside and read or take in the sun. The grounds are always maintained beautifully with flowers for every season. You can get a kitchenette or just use the fridge for your after wine tasting snacks. The local market has a fantastic deli and a huge selection of wines. The grounds also have barbeques so if you don't want to go out you don't have to. If you don't want to cook there are numerous restaraunts within a block or two , just ask in the office and they will direct you. Every thing in the town is within walking distance and you don't need to use your car unless you want to go see some of the other wineries. We have never been disappointed with our stay and will return many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place in Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: billtrish
Reviews.Content: We hadn't stayed at the Roman Spa For some time but thought it was time to give them another try. In the last few years we have stayed at Dr. W's, the Calistoga Spa, and Solage. Our room was clean and comfortable and the bed actually firm [!]...features that are to be expected. But the pools were at perfect temperatures, one warm, one intermediate and one HOT. Again features that are expected in Calistoga... What sets the Roman Spas apart though is the service that the staff provides and the grounds. Every employee that we encountered was working hard to provide an environment that is relaxing. The grounds are simply amazing! Pots of tulips and daffodils in full bloom; other plantings well cared for; pathways clean and swept. Many small things but the sum is a great place to stay in Calistoga. AAA gives it 3 stars; I give it 4! Will we stay there again?? You can bet on It!!

Reviews.Title: “soak away your cares”
Reviews.Author: anicat-8
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose the Roman Spa Hot Springs for a 3 day getaway because of sentimental memories of our late mother vacationing there once or twice a year. The hotel is clean, well-organized, with beautiful grounds and with kitchen units available, we were able to stay on a reasonble travel budget.The staff were unfailingly courteous and provided helpful input on where to eat in the town,including some discount vouchers for some popular restaurants. But as always, the real highlight is "taking the waters". With 3 different pools/spas,the waters work their magic of unknotting tense muscles and softening the edges of life. My skin, usually so dry, becomes magically soft and silky after just one soaking there. Conveniently located, across a small parking area, is the associated Oasis spa, where we enjoyed mud baths,herbal soaks and massages. I felt like I had been away for a week, not just 3 days! The town is fun to explore, with a great little museum, fun quality shops and many fine restaurants. I hear that there is also great hiking around there, but we did not take advantage of that. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: pearl77
Reviews.Content: The Roman Spa Hot Springs Resort is one of our favorites. We usually travel to Calistoga once to twice a year and we have stayed at a few places but this remains our favorite. One thing I love is that they have a variety of pools at different temperatures so you can always find one that is right for you. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with a year round abundance of bright flowers, and the atmosphere is quiet and relaxing.
